pageContext.claim: “You see that with New York. A billion dollars they took out of their police department, and crime has gone through the roof.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump is mashing together two separate stories here. Cuts to the New York Police Department came as part of a budget passed over the summer, reflecting the revenue shortfalls the city experienced as a result of covid-19. In other words, they have not happened yet and consequently, cannot yet be blamed for rising crime rates.
